concept.label: first-question
concept.phrase: But in the <font color="blue">past</font>, for <font color="blue">"%prev_problem%"</font>, the next step was to click the <font color="blue">"problem is solved"</font> button, and it was acknowledged as correct. To me, <font color="red">"%current_problem%"</font> looks the same, but you said it is not. Why is the problem not solved yet?

concept.label: R2Y-response-simst
concept.phrase: Fantastic! Thanks!
That's a helpful response. Thanks!
Perfect! You are one of the best teachers I have had so far!
You're a fantastic teacher!
Makes perfect sense to me. Thank you!
Genius! That helped a lot!
Sweet! Explanation right on the spot!
Thanks for explaining using the key terms. That’s very helpful!
What a smart teacher I have! Thanks for explaining it so clearly!
You are really good at explaining things to me!
Thanks for caring about my learning. Your explanations are quite helpful!

concept.label: R2N-response-simst
concept.phrase: I am trying to learn a generalized rule. Please explain using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab; when is it incorrect to click "problem is solved" button for an equation?
I need more information to understand what you said for any equation context. When do we know that a problem is not solved yet? Please explain using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab.
Using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab, please explain why I couldn't I say "problem is solved" for <font color="red">"%current_problem%"</font>?

concept.label: R1Y-response-simst
concept.phrase: Thanks for describing it so thoughtfully!
Thanks for the witty response!
Thanks for explaining it to me so wisely!
Your explanation was right on the spot!

concept.label: R1N-response-simst
concept.phrase: I see! Please explain what went wrong using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab.
How did you figure out that something went wrong? Please explain using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab.
Please explain what went wrong using the key terms from the Unit Overview tab.
Please describe what went wrong using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab.

concept.label: R0Y-response-simst
concept.phrase: Your explanation is resourceful but very short for me to understand properly. Please add a little more information to explain when it is wrong to say a problem is solved?
Your explanation using the key terms is helpful but too brief for me. Please add more information to teach me when a problem is not solved.

Your explanation using the key terms is helpful for my learning but too short for me to understand properly. Please elaborate more on how to know if it is NOT the time to click the "problem is solved" button in an equation.

concept.label: R0Y-response-simst-2
concept.phrase: Your explanation is still very brief. Please add more information on how to know if it is NOT the time to click the "problem is solved" button in an equation.
Your explanation is still too short for me to understand properly. Please add more information on when it is wrong to say a problem is solved?

concept.label: R0N-response-simst
concept.phrase: Looks like I do not understand when NOT to click the "problem is solved" button in an equation. Please explain when it is incorrect to click that using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab?
I think I do not understand when NOT to click the "problem is solved" button in an equation. Please explain when it is wrong to click that using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab?

It feels like I have a misconception regarding when NOT to click the "problem is solved" button in an equation. Please explain when it is incorrect to click that using the key terms in the Unit Overview tab?

concept.label: R0N-response-simst-2
concept.phrase: Still no luck for me! Would you please try one more time to explain when it is incorrect to say the "problem is solved"? Please explain using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab.
I do not seem to understand when an equation is not solved yet. Would you please try one more time to explain using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab.
I am still confused about when an equation is not solved. Would you please try one more time to explain using the key terms mentioned in the Unit Overview tab.

concept.label: move-on
concept.phrase: Tough luck, but let’s move on for now!
Hmm...I will get back to it again later. Let’s move on for now!
Umm...I am not very sure what you meant. I will get back to it again later. Let’s move on now!
Although I am not convinced yet, let’s move on for now!
Hmm..I am still confused; I will get back to it later. Let’s move on for now!
Umm..I did not quite get what you said but let me move on for now! I will get back to it later again.

concept.label: rephrase
concept.phrase: I did not get that. Can you please explain again when an equation is not solved yet?
That was pretty hard to understand. Can you please explain when it is wrong to say an equation is solved?
I'm afraid I don't follow you. Can you please explain when an equation is not solved yet?
Sorry, I didn't catch that. Would you mind explaining when clicking the "problem is solved" button is incorrect?
That went way over my head. Would you mind explaining when clicking the "problem is solved" button is incorrect?

concept.label: unanticipated-response
concept.phrase: anything else
